body.name: A Holiday By Gaslight: A Victorian Christmas Novella
body.description: "Readers will easily fall for Sophie and Ned in their gaslit surroundings." —Library Journal, starred reviewA Courtship of ConvenienceSophie Appersett is quite willing to marry outside of her class to ensure the survival of her family. But the darkly handsome Mr. Edward Sharpe is no run-of-the-mill London merchant. He's grim and silent. A man of little emotion--or perhaps no emotion at all. After two months of courtship, she's ready to put an end to things.A Last Chance for LoveBut severing ties with her taciturn suitor isn't as straightforward as Sophie envisioned. Her parents are outraged. And then there's Charles Darwin, Prince Albert, and that dratted gaslight. What's a girl to do except invite Mr. Sharpe to Appersett House for Christmas and give him one last chance to win her? Only this time there'll be no false formality. This time they'll get to know each other for who they really are.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Awwwww…still swooning here. In true Mimi Matthews style she has captured the heart and essence of a truly swoon worthy Christmas novella.Sophie was a great heroine, and will to enter a marriage of convenience to save her family from ruin due to her father’s extravagant spending. After two months she ends it. Ned is so stiff and so quiet. She feels she knows nothing about him or he her. She has no indication that he even cares. Of course her father is incensed that she took matters into her own hands and did so.Ned has admired Sophie since he first saw her. His feelings run deeper than he’ll admit. He gets a second chance when he spends Christmas with Sophie’s family. Can the repair the breach and be open and honest?This is a wonderful Christmas read that I heartily recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Perfect combo of family drama and romance!
reviews.reviewText: OVERALL STAR RATING: 4/5CLEAN RATING: 5/5My first Mimi Matthews read and it did not disappoint!Set in 1861 Victorian London, this novella follows the story of Sophie and Ned. They had been courting for two months when Sophie decided to end their relationship, confessing that she felt they weren’t at all compatible with each other. This book brings to light all the pressures of wealth and social status during the Victorian era. I can’t even imagine being pressured to marry someone simply on these things alone. Luckily Sophie has courage enough to stand up for what her heart believes in. Little did she realize though, perhaps, Ned WAS what her heart desired…only they hadn’t taken the time to get to know each other very well at all.Ned was so consumed by following The Gentlemen’s Guide to Etiquette that he didn’t let any of the REAL him be known. Let the lesson be learned…that even today…self help books aren’t ALWAYS the answer. Lol There is hope for a second chance romance once Sophie and Ned realize they didn’t go about their courtship properly the first time.Sophie’s dad is obsessed with his estate and modernizing everything from the lighting to the plumbing – all while draining his daughter’s dowries to pay for these lavish upgrades. While you will likely find yourself wanting to scream at the father for his poor choices, there is a deep personal reason behind his behavior. Not that it completely excuses what he was doing, but it did bring more understanding. Just enough family drama and romance balanced together to keep you turning page after page.I loved the way the author weaved in real life events such as the death of Prince Albert. The perfect holiday novella for fans of historical fiction and a great lesson on learning to live life authentically.*Please note there are a few uses of the word d*mn.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My best winter read
reviews.reviewText: Beautiful as a Christmas tree ornament! I love the wintery atmosphere, the cover reflects perfectly what you'll get. Sophie and Ned remind me of my own love story a bit.I think I will reread this one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I want a chunkier tale
reviews.reviewText: This book was a bit too short. I would have liked to have more written after where it ended.The story goes where a couple are courting for a few months, but the woman finds them to not be compatible enough, for her beau does not speak much and she speaks too much. She wants to know what he is thinking more. Right when they break it off, they start to get to know one another way more. Her family is having a party at the holidays and invite his family to join them. Her father is very much into new technology coming around, so he just had gaslights put all over the home, which was not cheap. More about that is mentioned as you read the book. It was not bad, but I just feel I would have liked to have more!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Delightful and Thought-provoking
reviews.reviewText: This is my first Mimi Mathews book and I was highly impressed. I loved the miss-understanding between Sophie and Ned and the will they/won't they of their relationship. It was interesting to see how Sophie and Ned saw the same circumstances SO different; they each perceived and assumed something about the other that was completely wrong, thus creating a little drama and fun. I also loved the Christmas festivities and the few references to the reason for the season. Overall, this was a fun and insightful Victorian novel.As others have mentioned, there are several references to Charles Darwin's "On the Origins of Species." Though I do not believe the evolution of man that he speculated, I did like how Sophie likened it to her own circumstances; I found it quite moving. Sophie recognized that we all need to change and adapt to our differing circumstances and that, as humans, we have CHOICE. She often says that we need to progress or we will be left behind. It reminded me of The Bellamy Brothers’ song, “Old Hippie”..."Should he hang on to the old, should he grab on to the new?" We all must change and grow and use our choices to become better people, and I feel that Sophie took this to heart as she tried to put the judgments and prejudices of the nobility behind her and embrace classes other than her own. The author uses this to effectively portray the tough transition from the Regency era to the Victorian era, and the changes the industrial revolution brought to the English people (not to mention, at the time, Darwin was quite the controversial piece, so it’s fitting for the novel time period).There were a few mild curse words (h*ll and dam*, and for the English, bloody) that actually flowed with the feeling of the book quite nicely. There were also a couple instances that were borderline taking the Lord's name in vain. I say borderline because, while they weren't strictly blasphemous (in fact I don’t believe the author meant them as such), they were more casual than I would like.CONTENT: mild language (see above), mild kissing, no innuendo or intimacy (proper romance)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars True Love Prevails
reviews.reviewText: This is one of the sweetest Christmas stories I’ve ever read! I recommend this to anyone who believes in Christmas Romance.
I enjoyed this heart warming, gut wrenching love story. The way Sophie and Ned conquered the social gaps, patiently and maybe a little timidly, make this, a different love story.

Je ne connaissais pas cette écrivaine mais ce livre était gratuit donc je l’ai pris pour voir. J’ai été enchantée par l’histoire et son style me plaît beaucoup. J’ai déjà acheté un autre de ses livres. Parfait pour passer un bon moment de détente.

It gives a mixed feeling of 'Pride and Prejudice' & 'North and South'. The way Matthews potrayed the Victorian era is very admirable.The romance between the two lead charecters are very neat and interesting.The development of each of the charecters are something to look forward to.The holiday theme was the cherry on the top. It will give you the cozy, country house, Victorian Christmas feeling 😁😁I'll 100% recommend you to read it ❤
Achei o livro muito bonitinho. A leitura é tranquila, não tem hot, mas tem um romantismo bem agradável, sem ser meloso.

Suelo preferir las novelas románticas con escenas de más pasión, pero buscaba una novela victoriana bien documentada y esta lo es. También es una novela muy bien escrita, que te engancha de una forma sutil y te deja con una sonrisa al final. Unos personajes muy bien creados y una trama sin grandes altibajos ni imprevistos, pero que sin embargo se disfruta de principio a fin.Seguiré a la autora.
